abstract_summ: CONCLUSIONS: Diabetic patients with COVID-19 patients are at higher risk of ICU admission and show an higher mortality risk.Additionally, ARDS patients with a lymphocyte/neutrophil ratio < 0.0537 had increased 28-day mortality rates (P = 0.0283).The main outcome was the risk of ICU admission in diabetic patients with COVID-19 infection while the second was the mortality risk in overall diabetic COVID-19 patients.STUDY DESING: A database search was conducted to identify studies comparing diabetic COVID-19 patients hospitalized in intensive care unit (ICU) and those reporting the overall mortality of these patients published up to March 25, 2020 within MEDLINE, Scopus and Web of Science.OBJECTIVES: To assess the risk of ICU admission and morality risk in diabetic COVID-19 patients.
title_summ: Prognostic factors for ARDS: clinical, physiological and atypical immunodeficiencyThe association between treatment with heparin and survival in patients with Covid-19Risk factors for hospital admission related to COVID-19 in inflammatory rheumatic diseasesCharacteristics associated with hospitalisation for COVID-19 in people with rheumatic disease: data from the COVID-19 Global Rheumatology Alliance physician-reported registryDiabetic patients with COVID-19 infection are at higher risk of ICU admission and poor short-term outcomeThe association between treatment with heparin and survival in patients with Covid-19
title_abstract_phrases: CONCLUSIONS: Diabetic patients with COVID-19 patients are at higher risk of ICU admission and show an higher mortality risk.Additionally, ARDS patients with a lymphocyte/neutrophil ratio < 0.0537 had increased 28-day mortality rates (P = 0.0283).The main outcome was the risk of ICU admission in diabetic patients with COVID-19 infection while the second was the mortality risk in overall diabetic COVID-19 patients.STUDY DESING: A database search was conducted to identify studies comparing diabetic COVID-19 patients hospitalized in intensive care unit (ICU) and those reporting the overall mortality of these patients published up to March 25, 2020 within MEDLINE, Scopus and Web of Science.Risk factors for hospital admission related to COVID-19 in inflammatory rheumatic diseasesOBJECTIVES: To describe patients with inflammatory rheumatic diseases (IRD) who had COVID-19; to compare patients who need hospital admission versus those that did not and assess risk factors of hospital admission related to COVID-19.
